repnme.cdata!: Improving rural schools in the Kyrgyz Republic

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            improving rural schools in the Kyrgyz Republic. Rural
            schools across the country were dilapidated, textbooks were
            rare, and teachers were underpaid and demotivated. Rural
            Education Project improved performance management systems
            for teachers and principals where teachers received
            financial incentives based on performance. Nearly 1.3
            million copies of textbooks were purchased and reprinted,
            which had greatly increased the country’s textbook stock.
            Schools bought new materials and refurbished laboratories
            and classrooms. Teachers focused on raising their
            professionalism, applying modern teaching methods, and
            establishing better interactions with students.
